scenarioDescription:
The BD-13 2130 Exoplanetary System


Overview

BD-13 2130 is a star with 2.12 times the mass of the Sun, and 19.17 times its radius. It is located 3017.64 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.74 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

BD-13 2130 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the BD-13 2130 system


BD-13 2130 b

BD-13 2130 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2007-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.66 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of BD-13 2130 b is 3110.040 times the mass of Earth. The radius of BD-13 2130 b is 12.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, BD-13 2130 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system BD-13 2130, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: BD-13 2130 - System With 1 Exoplanet
